title.narrative: EA 25/2019: Early Recovery Programme for people severely affected by floods in July 2019

description.narrative:
In July 2019 heavy monsoon downpour affected at least 28 Districts of middle, north, north-eastern and hilly regions of Bangladesh. Hundreds of thousands of people across Bangladesh have been displaced as many rivers and all four of the country’s major basins continued to rise due to incessant downpours and the rush of water from upstream i.e. north-east states of India. Between July and September 2019, people suffered from five types of natural disasters i.e. river flood, flash flood, landslide, river erosion and lightning. At least 114 people have died due to drowning, landslides, lightning and other flood-related reasons. More than 12,864 people have fallen ill due to flooding, water-borne diseases and other natural disasters. More than 25,677 houses are fully destroyed while 265,694 partially damaged. A total of 130,637 hactres of crops, 5,053 Education centers and Religious infrastructures, 304 bridges and culverts, 59,563 tube-wells, and 5,466 km roads have been damaged. A total of 286,051 livestock and 13,908 poultry birds died due to flooding.
This project will aim to support early recovery of severely flood affected people in the following seven districts: Bandarban, Sylhet, Sunamgonj, Jamalpur, Sirajgonj, Gaibandha and Kurigram.
